headline.main: SMOKING PERIL CITED IN INDUSTRY STUDY; Companies Funded A.M.A. Project Hoping to Refute U.S. Report

docs.abstract: AMA study indicates that cigarette smoking can cause irreversible heart damage and might be responsible for med maladies ranging from indigestion to cancer; study cost $15 million and took 14 yrs to complete; Dr Ira Singer comments (M)

keywords.value: TOBACCO, TOBACCO PRODUCTS AND SMOKERS ARTICLES
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, Aug. 5--Cigarette smoking can cause irreversible heart damage and might be responsible for medical maladies ranging from indigestion to cancer, researchers for the American Medical Association said today.
docs.snippet: CHICAGO, Aug. 5--Cigarette smoking can cause irreversible heart damage and might be responsible for medical maladies ranging from indigestion to cancer, researchers for the American Medical Association said today.
